intro: Sunaptea congesta, commonly known as the clustered sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sunaptea congesta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
